content: We have published the Normative Release 1 of the FHIRPath specification: http://hl7.org/fhirpath
A big thank you to everyone in the FHIRPath community for all your contributions!
We're already looking to the next release, there are already a lot of great feature requests, keep them coming and we'll start planning for the next version.
Awesome! @Grahame Grieve Can we get the links from https://www.hl7.org/fhir/fhirpath.html to point at this version?
Previously, they pointed at a snapshot version, and now they 404

Specifically, we need either:
A. that fhir page to point to the current "version-specific" link of fhirpath 2.0.0 (http://hl7.org/fhirpath/N1); or
B. fhirpath 2.0.0 to become available (in perpetuity) from http://hl7.org/fhirpath/r2
@Bryn Rhodes what actually happened here? Who actually published this?
Bryn provided the materials for a full site replacement
I replaced it
but you had no written procedure for doing that, so we have a problem
is this getting worked? would a jira ticket help?
see http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/product_brief.cfm?product_id=460 or http://hl7.org/FHIRPath
thanks lynn, but i don't see how that helps to fix the broken links at the top of https://www.hl7.org/fhir/fhirpath.html

Lee Surprenant said:

Specifically, we need either:
A. that fhir page to point to the current "version-specific" link of fhirpath 2.0.0 (http://hl7.org/fhirpath/N1); or
B. fhirpath 2.0.0 to become available (in perpetuity) from http://hl7.org/fhirpath/r2

was specifically talking about this
I think B would definitely be the easiest fix
it could even just redirect to http://hl7.org/fhirpath/N1
let me know if can help (e.g. by opening a ticket or contacting hl7 web admin @David Johnson ?)

I don't think a ticket's necessary. I would be available to do an update, but must coordinate with Lynn as her next update would override whatever change is made. I'll contact Lynn and keep this thread updated with the results.
I should fix this up, and it wasn't supposed to have happened without me (from my pov)
ok fixed
